question: You have seen an advertisement from a couple, who live in Australia, for someone to teach their two children your language for a year. Write a letter to the couple. In your letter explain why you think you would be suitable for the job, say what else you could do for the family, give your reasons for wanting the job.
text: I write this letter to express my interest in the position of language teacher for your two children, which I recently saw advertised in a local newspaper.

As you can see on my attached CV I completed a degree in Spanish at Valencia University, where I was trained to work as an instructor for boys and girls of young age. Additionally, I have taken a course on child psychology, that I think could be very helpful for educating young people. Furthermore, in my previous experience as a full-time janitor in a primary school, I was responsible for mentoring and nursing students.
On the other hand, people often describe me as a reliable, hard-working and resourceful worker. Therefore, I believe I can be a good mentor for your sons.
I am available for an interview at your earliest convenience. Please, do not hesitate in contacting me for further details.
